captions.text:
And l have
a favor to ask you.

l owe no favor to
you, goblin. Leave.

GOBLIN: But l have done
so much for you.

l have brought
you many souvenirs.

l have been
waiting for you both
many a winter moon.

and l will meet him
at each crossroads.

Good. But when can l have
that which is mine?
lt is for you to decide that.
lt is all the same to me.

My heart is filled
with dust and sand,

but you should know
it is his destiny

to bring about the
destruction of the Earth.

Not now, not tomorrow,
but soon enough.

Knowing that, you still
want him to live?

The time will come
and you, my dear,
l have done what l can.

Now, give him
a reason to live.

Hey, friend, what
about that which is mine?

Don't forget about me.
What about me?

title: Hellboy 2: The Golden Army (9/10) Movie CLIP - A Deal With the Angel of Death (2008) HD

Actually, ALL of the costumes were just make-up and prosthetics. Even the 
Angel of Death in this scene. No CGI here. If you don't believe me, you can 
look up Guillermo del Toro. He always uses prosthetics and make-up in his 
movies. It's like an extremely complicated Halloween costume party.

comments.text:
Got to meet Doug Jones at Fanboy Expo 2014 Knoxville, TN. One of the 
friendliest human beings you'll ever meet. Loves to touch peoples' faces. I 
asked him if there was a creature that he's always wanted to portray and he 
said an angel, I pointed this out and he laughed it off, "No, a more 
traditional angel, like Gabriel or Michael. An angelic warrior." Like a 
seraphim? *snaps fingers* "Exactly like a seraphim!"﻿
comments.author: ninjawraith17

comments.text:
For those wondering what the angel is doing with the stick and orbs on the 
floor - he is tracking time.

The entire floor is a calendar of sorts, with the end of the world marked.  
The nine orbs are the nine planets, and he is constantly updating their 
locations as they orbit the sun.  He knows that when the orbs reach a 
certain configuration, the End has come.﻿

comments.author: tweevers2

comments.text:
It's not a loophole.  It's his destiny to bring about the destruction of 
the earth, as it was her destiny to choose to allow him to live, that he 
may do so.

Free will is merely the mind choosing what it prefers (Edwards, 18th 
century American theologian).  Your preferences in turn are the product of 
genetics and environment - seemingly random evens; yet, all effects in the 
world seem random until a sufficiently powerful intellect understands their 
causes.

Destiny and free will are thus perfectly compatible.  Be happy that our 
destiny is to have free will in the first place.
comments.author: Tsc Admin

comments.text:
Good question. She'll agonize about seeing the one she loves most--and the 
father of her children--be the one who destroys the Earth. Ultimately, 
she'll know that it was her fault because she could have stopped it by 
letting him die right here in this scene, but she chose not to. As the 
Angel of Death says to Elizabeth, "the choice is yours." Quite the 
conundrum, and quite the living nightmare to experience.

ge-worden!. Denn der Filmemacher G.del Toro hat hier mitsamt-seiner

präsentiert wird, und Linda Blair einen Wunsch erfüllt, ist: BIPOLAR!. Man 
hört deutlich und, dies vor allem in der deutschen Fassung, eine jeweils 
WEIBLICHE wie zugleich Männliche Stimme gleichzeitig sprechen. Dies tat der 
Filmemacher bestimmt nicht umsonst. namaste

comments.text:
@InYahwehITrust Actually, there is a lot of debate as to what type of angel 
Satan is, ranging from Seraph to Cherub, to a singularly unique and 
altogether different type of angel, or even as a darker "aspect" of God 
Itself, all depending on what sources you read. That's why I like this 
movie's depiction of the character, it at once completely gets across the 
nature of the character, yet still remains ambiguous enough to make you 
wonder. Over all, I agree with you, this is the best depiction.
comments.author: TrueFinalBoss OfEverything
